clinical_study.brief_title: Difficult Intubation With Glidescope Video Laryngoscope
clinical_study.official_title: Incidence and Predictors of Difficult Intubation Adopting an Institutional Algorithm Glidescope Based: a Cohort Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Fondazione I.R.C.C.S. Istituto Neurologico Carlo Besta

clinical_study.source: Fondazione I.R.C.C.S. Istituto Neurologico Carlo Besta

brief_summary.textblock:
A prospective observational study on predictors available and on variables of difficult intubation adopting Gliscope video laryngoscope routinely.
Primary hypothesis of the current study is that the rate of difficult intubation with Glidescope is low and multiple predictors interact favorably in anticipating difficulties.

detailed_description.textblock:
All possible factors involved in difficult intubations were included in this prospective analysis.
Main predictors were considered: time to Cormack Lane using Glidescope intubation, Cormack Lane score, experience of the operator (staff or resident), number of bag mask ventilation, number of intubation attempts.

primary_outcome.measure: incidence of difficult intubation using Adnet score modified
primary_outcome.description: Difficult intubation in the current study is measured using Adnet score including the number of laryngoscopies

secondary_outcome.measure: incidence of difficult intubations in novices vs experts and complication in the overall cohort

study_pop.textblock: Patients undergoing neurosurgical procedures eligible for intubation in a tertiary neurosurgical centre

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- any patient up to ASA4 eligible for intubation for neurosurgical procedures
- any anesthesiologist in charge for GA
Exclusion Criteria:
- children
- patient not suitable for clinical evaluation of predictors for difficult intubation (ie. Parkinson's disease)
